title: How to Make Nadru Monje (Lotus Stem Fritters)

steps.headline: Prepare the lotus stems:
steps.description: Peel the lotus stems. Wash them under running water. Cut the stems into three big pieces. With the help of the vegetable chopper, make slices of the stems.

steps.headline: Place the chopped stems in a glass mixing bowl.
Add the other bowl's mixture to the bowl of water.
steps.description: Mix all of the ingredients together thoroughly, until all of the stems are coated with the rice flour batter.

steps.headline: Pour oil into a deep frying pan.
steps.description: Place it on a gas stove and switch it on to heat the oil. Immerse the battered lotus pieces in the oil to deep fry. Use tongs or a slotted spoon.

steps.headline: Keep moving the pieces from one side to the other so that they do not burn.
Take the fritters out.
steps.description: Once the fritters acquire the desired reddish color (see the photograph) and have a crispy texture, remove them from the oil.

steps.headline: Place the fritters on a piece of kitchen paper towel or piece of newspaper to remove the excess oil.
Serve the lotus stem fritters with Kashmiri onion chutney or tomato sauce.

text: Prepare the lotus stems: Peel the lotus stems. Wash them under running water. Cut the stems into three big pieces. With the help of the vegetable chopper, make slices of the stems. Place the chopped stems in a glass mixing bowl.  Add salt.  Add Kashmiri red chili powder.  Add cumin seeds.  Add rice flour.  Fill a bowl with water.  Add the other bowl's mixture to the bowl of water. Mix all of the ingredients together thoroughly, until all of the stems are coated with the rice flour batter. Pour oil into a deep frying pan. Place it on a gas stove and switch it on to heat the oil. Immerse the battered lotus pieces in the oil to deep fry. Use tongs or a slotted spoon. Keep moving the pieces from one side to the other so that they do not burn.  Take the fritters out. Once the fritters acquire the desired reddish color (see the photograph) and have a crispy texture, remove them from the oil. Place the fritters on a piece of kitchen paper towel or piece of newspaper to remove the excess oil.  Serve the lotus stem fritters with Kashmiri onion chutney or tomato sauce.
sentences: Prepare the lotus stems: Peel the lotus stems.
Wash them under running water.
Cut the stems into three big pieces.
With the help of the vegetable chopper, make slices of the stems.
Place the chopped stems in a glass mixing bowl.
Add salt.
Add Kashmiri red chili powder.
Add cumin seeds.
Add rice flour.
Fill a bowl with water.
Add the other bowl's mixture to the bowl of water.
Mix all of the ingredients together thoroughly, until all of the stems are coated with the rice flour batter.
Pour oil into a deep frying pan.
Place it on a gas stove and switch it on to heat the oil.
Immerse the battered lotus pieces in the oil to deep fry.
Use tongs or a slotted spoon.
Keep moving the pieces from one side to the other so that they do not burn.
Take the fritters out.
Once the fritters acquire the desired reddish color (see the photograph) and have a crispy texture, remove them from the oil.
Place the fritters on a piece of kitchen paper towel or piece of newspaper to remove the excess oil.
Serve the lotus stem fritters with Kashmiri onion chutney or tomato sauce.
